results.title: Oz shorts. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Roland Gallois, Catherine Birmingham, Robert Herbert, Bernard Purcell, Jo Bell, Sophie Jackson, Puss Puss Productions,, NRG Films Australia, Australian Film Commission, Arcadia Pictures and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A wonderful compilation of Australian short films from the early 1990’s. The films are: “He and She” (Dir: R. Herbert) - a bickering couple get picked up by the police; “Drive” (C. Birmingham) - a mother and son take to the road after killing the “old man”; “Lullabies” (R. Gallois) - a gut-wrenching experimental film on the trauma of a dissolving relationship; “Just Desserts” (M. Pellizzari) - a delicious comedy about an Italo-Australian girl’s sexual awakening and her love for her mama’s cooking; “Excursion to the Bridge of Friendship” (C. Andreef) - a sophisticated Sydney woman decides to invite her folk-singing Bulgarian cousin to Australia. A very funny “silent” film about culture clash.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roland Gallois, Catherine Birmingham, Robert Herbert, Bernard Purcell, Jo Bell, Sophie Jackson, Puss Puss Productions,, NRG Films Australia, Australian Film Commission, Arcadia Pictures and AFTRS

results.title: Oz animation: the new wave
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission and Ronin Films
results.brief_description: Considered by some to be the most talented Australian New Wave animators of the late 1980’s-early 90’s, this back to back compilation showcases many incredible techniques and creative minds by these filmmakers.

results.title: Oyster man
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Julian Biggs, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of oyster farming in the Gulf of St. Lawrence, showing the various stages of oyster cultivation: the sampling of minute larvae by Department of Fisheries biologists, the staking of oyster beds by farmers, the nurturing of spat, and underwater scenes showing the dragging of the sea bed with cotton mops to ensnare starfish which prey upon the oyster. Final sequences show the grading and shipping of oysters and their arrival at the sea food restaurant or family dinner table, where they delight the eyes and palates of oyster lovers.

results.title: Oxygen: an introduction to chemistry
results.creator_credit: Jim Callner, Hans Halberstadt and Barr Films
results.brief_description: Explores the nature of oxygen. Shows that oxygen has three forms: solid, liquid and gas, and that when it combines with other atoms it forms new chemical compounds. Illustrates how animals use oxygen to release energy for activity and how plants use carbon dioxide to produce oxygen.

results.title: Oxidation and reduction
results.creator_credit: Herman J. Engel, Max J Rosenberg and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the relationship and the differences between oxidation and reduction. Explains this type of reaction in terms of electron transfer. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Owning Mahowny
results.creator_credit: Richard Kwietniowski, Seaton McLean, Andras Hamori, Alessandro Camon, Natural Nylon, H2O Motion Pictures and Alliance Atlantis
results.brief_description: Impressive thriller about a mild-mannered, nebbish bank manager who, due to an obsessive gambling addiction, embezzles the bank where he works for several million dollars. Phillip Seymour Hoffman plays Dan Mahowny as a man whose self-delusions run deep, and whose desire to not only to remain in denial but also to keep his covert life secret from others, leads to extreme measures. What makes the film interesting is the way that Dan’s obsession and subsequent daring embezzlement builds slowly, spiralling out of his control. Hoffman depicts a man deluded but also conflicted by his choices that results in a great deal of suffering. Based on a true story.

results.title: Owning a Pony : A Guide for Beginners
results.brief_description: Any parent considering buying a pony for their child would benefit from the advice offered in this film which is aimed at encouraging the child to take an active responsibility in the care of the pony. The aspects of “Owning a pony” covered in this program are “Buying a pony”, “Accommodation”, “Equipment”, “Feeding”, “Mucking-out”, “Grooming”, “Cleaning tack” and “Tacking up”.
